content.title: Seed Testing Laboratory Scheme
content.details: The “Seed Testing Laboratory Scheme” is a State Plan Scheme, which is implemented by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. The objective of the scheme is to assist seed testing services to farmers to ensure the viability and purity of seed to be sown.
benefits: Popularising seed testing services to farmers.
Seed testing service and training for all farmers.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
content.application_process: The eligible bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper. Along with the application, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the relevant documents at the nearest office of the Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/Agriculture Circle.
documents_required: Documents proof of having sufficient available cultivable land

faqs.question: What is Seed Testing Laboratory Scheme?
faqs.answer: Seed Testing Laboratory Scheme intends to assist seed testing services to farmers to ensure the viability and purity of seed to be sown.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers of Meghalaya who are engaged in agriculture are eligible to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: Popularising seed testing services to farmers.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/service?
faqs.answer: Seed testing service and training for farmers.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Agriculture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers having sufficient available cultivable land on a first come first served basis.
